Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.name: Pepper Bacterial Spot
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit that turn dark brown.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use copper-based bactericides and remove infected plants.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds and improve air circulation around plants.

Pepper__bell___healthy.name: Healthy Bell Pepper
Pepper__bell___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Leaves and fruit appear healthy.

Potato___Early_blight.name: Potato Early Blight
Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark spots on leaves with concentric rings, leading to defoliation.
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides like azoxystrobin or chlorothalonil.
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Ensure adequate spacing, remove infected debris, and rotate crops.

Potato___Late_blight.name: Potato Late Blight
Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Grayish-brown lesions on leaves and stems, often with white mold.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Use fungicides containing copper or metalaxyl.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, avoid overhead watering, and rotate crops.

Potato___healthy.name: Healthy Potato
Potato___healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Leaves and stems appear healthy.
Potato___healthy.prevention: Ensure good soil conditions and regular care.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.name: Tomato Bacterial Spot
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves that turn brown and scab over.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds and rotate crops.

Tomato_Early_blight.name: Tomato Early Blight
Tomato_Early_blight.symptoms: Brown spots with concentric rings on lower leaves, causing defoliation.
Tomato_Early_blight.treatment: Use fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil.
Tomato_Early_blight.prevention: Remove infected debris and avoid overhead watering.

Tomato_Late_blight.name: Tomato Late Blight
Tomato_Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked spots on leaves that enlarge, turn brown, and appear oily.
Tomato_Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing copper or chlorothalonil promptly.
Tomato_Late_blight.prevention: Rotate crops, avoid overhead watering, and ensure proper spacing for air circulation.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.name: Tomato Leaf Mold
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on leaves, accompanied by a velvety mold underneath.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.treatment: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides containing mancozeb.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.prevention: Maintain low humidity, improve ventilation, and space plants adequately.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.name: Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Circular spots with dark edges on lower leaves, causing defoliation.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Use fungicides such as chlorothalonil and remove affected leaves.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Avoid wetting leaves, rotate crops, and remove plant debris.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.name: Tomato Spider Mites (Two-Spotted)
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.symptoms: Yellow or bronzed leaves with fine webbing.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.treatment: Use insecticidal soap or neem oil to control mites.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.prevention: Encourage natural predators like ladybugs and avoid over-fertilization.

Tomato__Target_Spot.name: Tomato Target Spot
Tomato__Target_Spot.symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves that expand with concentric rings.
Tomato__Target_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or copper-based sprays.
Tomato__Target_Spot.prevention: Avoid wetting leaves and improve ventilation around plants.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.symptoms: Yellowing and curling of leaves, stunted growth, and reduced fruit production.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.treatment: Remove infected plants and control whiteflies with insecticides.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties and reflective mulch to deter whiteflies.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled yellow and green leaves with distorted shapes.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: Remove infected plants and sanitize tools.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties and avoid handling plants when wet.

Tomato_healthy.name: Healthy Tomato
Tomato_healthy.symptoms: No visible symptoms. Leaves and fruit appear healthy.
